page.title: 06SCOUTING IN SOUTH REIGATE
page.content: Scouting was started by Robert Baden Powell in 1908. The 2nd Reigate(St.Johns)was found -ed in 1908,around boys who met at the last lamp post in Common Road,by Wallace Peat. The Scout Group H.Q.is in Old Vic- arage outhouses in Earlswood Road.In 1985:25 cubs(8-11yrs);21 Scouts (11- 16yrs). In 1911 the St Luke's Troop(now 14th Reigate)was formed by the Rev. Shepherd Smith and Guy.S.Moser.The original Headquarters in Smith Road still stands,but they now use a hut in Sandcross Lane.1985:2 cub packs with 32 boys;21 scouts. In 1913 the Meadvale Troop(34th) was formed by A.Makovski and met in the Parish rooms in Somerset Road; the group now has a H.Q. building be- hind.1985:24 cubs; 13 scouts.
